answerText: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance spectroscopy [or NMR][10] This quantity, typically measured in parts per million, measures the difference between the frequencies of various nuclei in an NMR sample. It is denoted with a lowercase delta.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale B + Bellarmine  | 8 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This technique involves placing a chemical sample in a strong magnetic field, then applying a magnetic pulse at a different angle. For 10 points: [10] Name this technique, frequently used to identify organic compounds.
